meanings.definition: A family of fish that includes salmon and trout.
meanings.sent1: Salmonids are known for their ability to swim upstream.
meanings.sent2: I saw a school of salmonids swimming in the river.
meanings.sent3: Why did the salmonids bring a compass to the river? To find their way back home!
meanings.sent4: The river was a highway of silver as the salmonids raced upstream.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering scales of the salmonids glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of salmonids.
meanings.sent1: The salmonids habitat must be cold and clear.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the salmonids population in the river.
meanings.sent3: Why did the salmonids throw a party? To celebrate their watery world!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the salmonids swimming against the current.
meanings.sent5: The river echoed with the splashing sounds of the salmonids.

meanings.definition: Any fish belonging to the family Salmonidae.
meanings.sent1: The angler caught a beautiful salmonid in the lake.
meanings.sent2: Salmonids are prized by fishermen for their taste.
meanings.sent3: Why did the salmonid refuse to share its fishing spot? It was a little shellfish!
meanings.sent4: The salmonid leaped gracefully out of the water, a silver flash against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The river teemed with life as the salmonids swam in a synchronized dance.
